name: Advising Pathways
description: A web application made for Computer Science Students at Georgia Tech to help explore curriculum requirements and options through surveys, gamified walkthroughs, and detailed advising information.

name: Buzz Database
description: A multi-threaded, SQL-like database that supports transactions, logging, and query optimization while maintaining ACID properties.

name: Command Line Chatroom
description: A chat room hosted by a server that clients can connect to with either UDP or TCP in their terminal.

name: Chess Tactic Classification
description: Convolutional Neural Network and Decision Tree models trained to classify strategies in sequences of chess moves recommended by Chess Engines.

name: Climate Change Prediction and Visualization
description: An interactive visualization that showcases predictive models that forecast future surface temperatures across various global regions.

name: Anime Recommendation System
description: A python notebook that demonstrates a collaborative filtering system using SVD factorization that suggests content for users based on their existing preferences.

name: Board Game Data Visualization
description: A set of interactive web visualizations that display various properties of Board Games

name: Distributed Systems Labs
description: An implementation of server clusters performing database replication using distributed system strategies like Primary-Backup, Multi-Paxos, and Google Spanner.

name: FarmGuardians
description: A farm simulation game with simple visuals and a basic user interface that allows players to manage a virtual farm.

name: FlexBros
description: A web application to help users build workout routines and monitor progress by utilizing a workout calendar to display routines and log daily performance.

name: GBA Pong Game
description: A basic Pong game for a Game Boy Advance (GBA) emulator utilizing Direct Memory Access (DMA).

name: Image Feature Extraction
description: An implementation of the Harris corner detection algorithm and SIFT feature extraction technique to match features between two different images of the same scene.

name: Machine Learning-Based Image Compression
description: An implementation of the GMM, K-means, and PCA machine learning techniques used to perform image compression.

name: Image Description for the Visually Impaired
description: A simple web application that utilizes LLMs and VQA models to generate detailed image descriptions for visually impaired individuals.

name: 3D Model Visualization with Implicit Surfaces
description: A display of 3D models drawn by using implicit surface drawing techniques with twist, taper, and bend deformation techniques.

name: Computer Architecture Simulation
description: A circuit simulation of a simple computer architecture built entirely out of logic gates that includes essential components such as a bus, RAM, a register file, and an ALU.

name: Machine Learning for Network Traffic
description: A simulation of network traffic that utilized a PAYL model to identify normal and attack payloads.

name: Malware Behavior Analysis
description: A virtual environment to perform malware analysis by reconstructing the control flow graph and performing symbolic execution on sample malware.

name: Virtual Memory Page Simulator
description: A program to simulate virtual memory, complete with page eviction and replacement policies.

name: 3D Mesh Manipulation with Subdivision
description: A display of 3D polygon meshes that can be manipulated by Loop and Butterfly subdivision techniques.

name: Mini Internet Simulation
description: A simulation of internet connectivity where each member controlled an Autonomous System that had to interconnect using OSPF and iBGP protocols.

name: Network Monitoring and Attack Analysis
description: An analysis of DDoS, brute force, web attacks, and botnet attacks on an AWS network topology to create network rules to prevent each type of attack.

name: Diabetes Risk Prediction
description: A trained neural network with hidden layers and gradient descent to predict the risk of diabetes in individuals.

name: Pacman AI Agent Implementation
description: An AI trained to play Pacman with the BFS, DFS, UCS, A*, Q-Learning, and MDP algorithms,

name: Penetration Testing Simulation
description: A simulated CGI program to run reverse shell exploits on open ports to gain escalated privileges.

name: Process Scheduler
description: An implementation of various algorithms for an operating system scheduling multi-threaded processes.

name: Projection Matrix Estimation with RANSAC
description: An implementation of Project Matrix reconstruction given multiple images from a scene using the RANSAC algorithm to determine the epipolar lines between the images.

name: Mushroom Species Classification
description: A trained random forest model to perform classification on unknown mushroom samples.

name: Distribution Ray Tracer
description: A ray tracer optimized with a bounding volume hierarchy that features advanced shading techniques such as highlights, reflections, and special effects.

name: Real-Time Transport Protocol
description: An implementation of RTP using threads with a packet queue system to send files from a server and a client.

name: CNNs for Scene Recognition
description: A Convolutional Neural Networks developed and trained to classify scenes of various rooms or environments.

name: Simulated L2 Cache
description: A code implementation of a multi-core processor utilizing an L2 cache with DRAM.

name: Simulated OoO processor
description: A code implementation of a 7-stage processor with a L1 cache, a Reorder Buffer and a Register Alias Table for out-of-order processing.

name: Simulated Superscalar Processor
description: A code implementation of an N-wide superscalar processor with 5 basic stages to manage pipeline dependencies and branch predictions.

name: NYC Taxi Data Analysis
description: A data pipeline to perform analysis on NYC taxi trip data on various cloud platforms.

name: Travel Reservations Service
description: A SQL database for travel reservations with an ERD, SQL Tables, and stored procedures for day-to-day operations.

name: Cross-Site Scripting Attack Simulation
description: A simulated web application to demonstrate both reflective and stored cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.
